algorithm_technique: Sliding Window with two pointers and frequency tracking
Sliding Window using inclusion-exclusion principle (count(k) - count(k+1))
problem_summary_simple: Count substrings with all 5 vowels and exactly k consonants.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a sliding window to maintain vowel and consonant counts. Solution 1 uses a three-pointer approach; Solution 2 uses inclusion-exclusion on a helper function.
key_insights: The problem requires a sliding window to efficiently check all substrings.
Maintaining counts of vowels and consonants within the window is key.
The three-pointer approach (left, mid, right) helps to find valid start points for substrings once the window satisfies the conditions.
The problem can be reframed as finding substrings with at least k consonants and subtracting those with at least k+1 consonants.
A helper function `count(k)` counts substrings with at least k consonants and all vowels.
This inclusion-exclusion approach simplifies the logic by focusing on a 'at least' condition.
